page.title: 05Slaughterford
page.content:
Slaughterford is a village 3km away from Colerne. Slaughterford has a church, but it is quite small it would hold a congregation of about 40-50. The church was left in ruins for 200 years because it was ransacked by Cromwell. It was rebuilt in 1823 but the original tower still remains.
There are still remains of an old rag mill which was driven by water. Most of the water wheel is made of iron and the spokes are wooden. A few metres away there is an oven which was used for baking bread.
Slaughterford used to be on the main route for coaches to go from London to Bath.There used to be stables for the horses,an old brewery,a coach house,a water pump for all the houses,four weavers cottages and a lodgers house.
